rewardedBad.criticism: Frank Abagnale lied, forged checks, and impersonated people.
rewardedBad.result: He became a millionaire, avoided long prison time, and was hired by the FBI.

rewardedBad.criticism: Lance Armstrong doped for years while competing.
rewardedBad.result: He won 7 Tour de France titles and gained fame and fortune before being exposed.

rewardedBad.criticism: Jordan Belfort scammed investors out of millions.
rewardedBad.result: He served a short sentence and made more money selling his story and book.

rewardedBad.criticism: Logan Paul filmed highly inappropriate content for clout.
rewardedBad.result: It exploded his fame, and now he’s a multi-millionaire brand owner and WWE star.

rewardedBad.criticism: Steve Jobs was known for being controlling and harsh to employees.
rewardedBad.result: Apple became one of the most successful companies in history under his leadership.

punishedGood.criticism: Edward Snowden exposed mass government surveillance to protect civil rights.
punishedGood.result: He became a fugitive and had to live in exile.

punishedGood.criticism: Colin Kaepernick peacefully protested police violence by kneeling.
punishedGood.result: He was blackballed from the NFL and hasn't played since.

punishedGood.criticism: Aaron Swartz fought for open access to academic knowledge.
punishedGood.result: He was aggressively prosecuted and died by suicide before trial.

punishedGood.criticism: Malala Yousafzai advocated for girls’ education.
punishedGood.result: She was shot in the head by the Taliban at age 15.

punishedGood.criticism: Rosa Parks refused to give up her bus seat in a peaceful protest.
punishedGood.result: She was arrested and lost her job.
